newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Sun to sign Israel cooperation accord.
newsitem.headline: Sun to sign Israel cooperation accord.

text.p: Sun Microsystems Inc president Ed Zander will sign on June 16 an industrial cooperation agreement with the Israeli government, the U.S. company said on Tuesday.
One aspect of the framework agreement is a commitment by Sun to buy Israeli products equal to 35 percent of what it will sell to the Israeli government, a company spokesman said.
Zander will be in Israel to attend the Interworld trade show on June 16-18 in Jerusalem. He will hold a news conference in Tel Aviv on June 15.
Sun, a leading provider of servers and workstations and developer of the Java Internet programming language, is increasing its presence in Israel.
It has established a subsidiary in Israel to further its business and opened a Java development centre in Herzliya.
During the last year the company's buyback purchases in Israel reached $25 million, most of them from Check Point Software Technologies Ltd.
